questions.question_text:
During a design workshop for a stretched vSAN cluster, the requirement that some of the VMs be configured with no-mirror between sites was discussed.
Which three recommendations should the architect provide to address an event of a network partition between two sites? (Choose three.)

choices.F: One of isolation addresses should reside in the site 2 data center
choices.C: One of isolation addresses should reside in the site 1 data center
choices.B: The default gateway must be used as the only isolation address
choices.E: One isolation address reachable only from the witness appliance in both sites
choices.D: VMware vSphere DRS rules to force the VMs to run where the data resides
choices.A: Host isolation response must exclude the VMs required

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDF
CDF is correct for sure...here

Network Isolation Response and Multiple Isolation Response
Addresses
In a Virtual SAN Stretched Cluster, one of the isolation addresses should reside
in the site 1 datacenter and the other should reside in the site 2 datacenter. This
would enable vSphere HA to validate complete network isolation in the case of
a connection failure between sites. 

https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/techpaper/VMware-Virtual-SAN-6.1-Stretched-Cluster-Guide.pdf/subassets/page38.pdf
I think CDF

✑ Maximize the vSAN datastore usable capacity.
✑ Deduplication and compression are required to help utilize available capacity efficiency.
✑ Ensure the highest level of resiliency wherever possible.
Which disk group configuration should the architect include in the design?
